result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather Ann Schoon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Heather Ann Schoon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Heather Ann Schoon was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Heather Ann Schoon was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Heather Ann Schoon was found guilty of Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: DOC Collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain employment and/or continue with education.

Maintain absolute sobriety.  No alcohol.  May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional.  May not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol.
No contact with JG or JG's family, residence, place of employment or elsewhere.

supervisions.notes:
Count 1 HELD OPEN, if defendant successfully completes all conditions of agreement, defendant may petition to dismiss Count 1 only.
Concurrent with 15CF1882.

miscConds.notes:
DOC COLLECT -   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  
ORDER to follow.
$453.00 due 7-14-2016 DIRECTLY to Clerk of Court.

Huber.
  Stayed-Defendant to call Jail Diversion Office 373-3880 M-F 7am-3pm within 3 business days or by 5-12-2016 for report date w/in 75 days or by 7-21-2016  Failure to do so within the specified time will result in the immediate issuance of a commitment to Jail without huber privileges and new criminal charges.
Concurrent with 15CF1882.

Activity: Sentencing hearing
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

01:16 PM Defendant Heather Ann Schoon in court by video means, in custody at the Rock County Jail and with attorney Shanna Knueppel by video means.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video means. Defendant waives right to appear in person in courtroom. Court orders on Count 1 - 2 years Wisconsin State Prison and 3 years Extended Supervision, any treatment deemed necessary, maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, may not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional, may not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol, maintain employment and/or continue with education, no contact with JG or JG's family, residence, place of employment or elsewhere, DOC collect costs, 99 days sentence credit. Defendant is eligible for Challenge and Earned Release Programs.
Sentencing hearing on February 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
